title: Mysterious Legends of Edinburgh, etc
author: Leighton, Alexander
snippet: And without further interruption than her own laugh, theyproceeded till they came to the entry called Big LochendClose, up which they went some forty or fifty steps, till theycame to an outer door, which led by a short dark passage totwo or three inner doors in succession, all leading to separaterooms occupied by separate people. No sooner had theyturned into this passage than they encountered a woman ina plaid and with a lantern in her hand, who had just left thethird or innermost room, and whose face, as it peered throughthe thick folds of her head-covering, was illuminated by a gleamfrom the light she carried.
